intro: Xanthosoma mexicanum, commonly known as the Mexican arrowroot, is a tropical plant belonging to the Araceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 1 meter in length. The plant produces an inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a spathe, typical of the Araceae family. Its corms are edible and are often used as a starch source in traditional cuisines.
